task.title: Record using an existing test case

taskbody.context:
With Web Recorder, you can modify existing test cases instead of creating a brand new test case.
Follow these steps:

step.cmd: Open any existing test case to continue recording.
Click on the Record icon to open Web Recorder. A confirmation dialog appears asking you to continue on recording the current test case.

stepresult.p: If you choose No, I want a clean session, opens a new recording session without any pre-recorded steps from the current test case.

If you choose Yes, all the existing test steps and test case variables are imported to the Recorded Actions and Variables tabs in Web Recorder respectively. You do not need to repeat the test steps having been recorded.record on existing test case

step.cmd: When saving your script, automatically detects similar existing objects in the Objects Repository and asks you for further action to optimize the Object Repository.Add element to object repository
step.info:
The objects highlighted in red are objects already existed in the Object Repository. identifies duplicate objects based on the ID (for example: Object Repository/Page_CURA Healthcare Service/a_Make Appointment) and several attributes of the object.
You can select one of these options to save:
Merge changes into existing objects: Add unique changes of the newly recorded object to the existing object, but still keep the existing object ID.
Create duplicate objects: Save the newly recorded object separately from the existing object.
Replace existing objects: The newly recorded object overrides the ID and attributes of the existing object.
